questions.question: Which component of a computer is responsible for executing instructions?
What is the primary difference between RAM and ROM?
options: RAM is non-volatile, while ROM is volatile
RAM is temporary storage, while ROM is permanent storage
ROM stores data permanently but is erased when power is off
questions.answer: RAM is temporary storage, while ROM is permanent storage

questions.question: Which function key is commonly used to enter the BIOS/UEFI setup during boot?
Which of the following file formats is NOT used for storing images?
Which keyboard shortcut allows you to open Task Manager quickly in Windows?
What is the primary advantage of an SSD over an HDD?
options: Lower power consumption and faster read/write speeds
questions.answer: Lower power consumption and faster read/write speeds

What is the primary function of an operating system?
options: Managing computer hardware and software resources
questions.answer: Managing computer hardware and software resources
